page.title: 03HILL FARMING ON THE PENNINES
page.content: Three farms were visited, all of them being over 1,000 feet above sea level. Lower Drake Hill is a beef, sheep, and arable farm of 500 acres carrying 600 sheep and 240 beef cattle. Barley is bought in, turnips are grown, and silage is made from the grass to feed the animals in winter. Four full time workers are employed. Woodroyd Hill is a dairy farm typical of this area with 80 milk cows and 80 sheep on 285 acres. Silage is made and potatoes, swede and barley grown. There are two workers here. Dick Edge Farm is the smallest; it has only 38 acres. 17 acres are used for the 17 milking cows. Silage, potatoes and turnips are grown and two people are employed. The two large farms had a lot of machinery which was important for getting the work done.
